Key Match Events: Chris Taylor RBI single in the second inning
Austin Barnes two-run double that just got over the head of third baseman Ramón Urías
Colton Cowser hit a three-run homer to cut into the Dodgers’ lead
Blake Treinen striking out Gunnar Henderson to strand the bases loaded in the seventh inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers were aware of the D-backs and Padres, the two teams chasing them in the National League West, had lost their respective games, which was an opportunity to gain a game on both.
Manager Dave Roberts emphasized the importance of preparing for the postseason and the value of winning baseball games.
The team was without Freddie Freeman and Will Smith, but still managed to have a great homestand.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts expressed pride in the team's performance, stating that they'showed well' and 'found ways to win baseball games.'
Bobby Miller reflected on his outing, saying that it was '4 2/3 of really good pitching and then just one bad pitch.'
Blake Treinen expressed his goal of being the best in baseball at his role in the bullpen.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers finished off the nine-game homestand with a 7-2 record.
The team will continue to evaluate their options over the next five weeks, including Bobby Miller, who has struggled in his sophomore season.
The Dodgers will face the D-backs at Chase Field in a highly anticipated series.
Others: The NL West race is one of the closest in the Majors.
The Dodgers and the D-backs have been two of the hottest teams since the All-Star break.
